Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup; in tondo, bounded by three bands, black-figure decoration consisting of decorated lower edge of garment of running female.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Brijder attributes the sherd to the C Painter's Middle Period.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 92 no. 317 pl. 68)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 447-8, no. B741, pl. XXIX)
Brijder Siana III 2000 / Siana Cups III: The Red-black Painter, Griffin-bird Painter, and Siana Cups resembling Lip-cups (p. 718, Add. no. 32)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1322) (phase 3)
